intro: Pseudolopezia, commonly known as the false lopezia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, tubular florets arranged in composite flower heads. Pseudolopezia species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
